Cuerpo: Please feel free to correspond: Miles Murdocca Department of Computer Science Rutgers University, Hill Center New Brunswick, NJ 08903 murdocca@cs.rutgers.edu http://www.cs.rutgers.edu/~murdocca/ (908) 445-2654 (phone);  (908) 445-0537 (fax) This page has been visited times since 5 December 1995, as recorded by the web counter . Teaching Interests CS211: Introduction to Computer Architecture CS352: Internet Technology Graduate and Undergraduate Independent Studies What I am Working on These Days Internet based distributed archiving system (The DISTANCE Project). All of this takes time (there are over 400 illustrations, and lots of equations and other details that need to be reworked) but you can have a look at how far the project has progressed. You name it; it's here This site has links to all of the cool Internet stuff you've been hearing about. From the creators of the original Mosaic Web browser. The Web Museum. Music from unaffiliated artists. From the makers of the cable TV Discovery channel. IN Jersey. Online newspaper provided by New Jersey's Asbury Park Press. The Rutgers University daily newspaper. Here is what he has to say about the project. Promotional clips from the movie giant. You need an MPEG player for the 15 second video. Lots of good free software for networking, multimedia, and other things. The Web Masters page. At Rutgers University, you can print it out using the lpr command from a Unix machine: % lpr -Pprinter_name HTMLPrimer.ps If you can't do it this way, then you can find an on-line hypertext version at the URL: http://www.ncsa.uiuc.edu/General/Internet/WWW/HTMLPrimer.html.
